Praveen Kumar Just Created History As He Becomes First Indian Man To Win A Wushu World Championship Gold

Praveen Kumar Just Created History As He Becomes First Indian Man To Win A Wushu World Championship Gold

Praveen Kumar is the first Indian man to win a wushu World Championships gold.

He won 2-1 in the men's sanda event.

Twitter

In 2017, Pooja Kadian was the first Indian to be crowned world champion.

Wushu sanda is a martial art comprising of full-contact kickboxing, wrestling, takedowns, throws, sweeps and kick catches.

With Inputs From PTI.
description: Praveen Kumar on Wednesday became the first Indian man to win a wushu World Championships gold, beating Russel Diaz of Philippines in the 48kg category here. The Indian saw off his Filipino opponent 2-1 in the men's sanda event of the 15th World Wushu Championships. Praveen had earlier defeated Uzbekistan's Khasan Ikromov 2-0 in the semifinal on Tuesday to set up the summit clash with Diaz.
